meanings.definition: A large cylindrical bag of heavy material; for carrying personal belongings
meanings.sent1: I packed all my clothes in a duffel for the camping trip.
meanings.sent2: She slung her duffel over her shoulder and headed to the gym.
meanings.sent3: The duffel was so full, it looked like it might burst at the seams!
meanings.sent4: His duffel was a bottomless pit, fitting everything he needed.
meanings.sent5: The duffel bulged with snacks, ready for the road trip ahead.

meanings.definition: A coarse woolen cloth with a thick nap
meanings.sent1: The jacket was made of warm duffel to keep out the cold.
meanings.sent2: She wrapped herself in a cozy duffel blanket by the fireplace.
meanings.sent3: The duffel fabric felt rough against his skin but kept him warm.
meanings.sent4: The duffel scarf was so soft, it felt like a hug around her neck.
meanings.sent5: The duffel material was perfect for the winter coat, providing both warmth and style.

meanings.definition: A heavy woolen cloth with a thick nap, used for coats
meanings.sent1: The tailor recommended using duffel for the winter coat.
meanings.sent2: She admired the classic look of the duffel coat in the store window.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his duffel coat was so warm, he could survive an Arctic expedition.
meanings.sent4: The duffel fabric of the coat was as sturdy as it was stylish.
meanings.sent5: The duffel coat enveloped her in warmth, shielding her from the winter chill.
